titleStmt.title: Digital Edition of Glaser Abklatsch ID: AT-OeAW-BA-3-27-A-GL1138
AT-OeAW-BA-3-27-A-GL1138

item.term: Early first millennium to the fourth century BC (predominance of Saba)
Fourth to first centuries BC (predominance of Qataban and Hadramawt, and their alliance with Main)
First century BC to early second century AD (alliances between the tribes of the high plateau and the ASA kingdoms)
Late second to late third centuries AD (wars among the Himyar, Saba and Hadramawt)
Fourth to sixth centuries AD (unification of Yemen under Himyarite rule)
It corresponds to the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans with sub-periods I-IV
First sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Second sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Second sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Second sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Third sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Fourth sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Fourth sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans

graphic.desc: By kind permission of British Museum

1.[… … … … …] and [..] was [..] 2.in the irrigation canal: 6 cubits. And may 3.Yishhurmalik build a channel to this irrigation 4.[canal. And may] he enable irrigation through this channel 5.or the irrigation canal, of which there belongs to Ḥammānum [one-] 6.[third] of its two (areas of) water. And to Shahrmalik belong two 7.portions of the two (areas of) water, and (may) he cede to Ḥammā- 8.[nu]m water for irrigation. And to Yishhurmali[k] there belong 9.each of the two (areas of) water. And, should Yishhurmalik object (to this), 10.let him release water to the irrigation canal. 11.And Yithāʿkarib and ʿAmmīʿ[… … …] 12.[… …] the irrigation cana[l … …]

… … … … … and .. was ..
in the irrigation canal:
cubits. And may
Yishhurmalik build a channel to this irrigation
canal. And may he enable irrigation through this channel
or the irrigation canal, of which there belongs to Ḥammānum one-
third of its two areas of water. And to Shahrmalik belong two
portions of the two areas of water, and may he cede to Ḥammā-
num water for irrigation. And to Yishhurmalik there belong
each of the two areas of water. And, should Yishhurmalik object to this,
let him release water to the irrigation canal.
And Yithāʿkarib and ʿAmmīʿ… … …
… … the irrigation canal … …
